title: Aperture.v3.5.1.Multilingual.MacOSX.Retail-CORE
description:
Aperture combines the control and speed pros want for demanding photo tasks with the easy learning curve iPhoto users need to step up to an advanced photo tool.
It has been fully optimized for the Retina display on the new MacBook Pro, letting you browse and edit high-resolution images with remarkable clarity and resolution. And with a new unified photo library, you can now move seamlessly from iPhoto to Aperture Ã¢â‚¬â€  and back Ã¢â‚¬â€ without having to import, export, or reprocess your photos. Aperture is packed with innovative adjustment tools to refine your images, including a revolutionary Auto White Balance that uses skin tones to correct color casts, and a professional Auto Enhance that applies Exposure, Vibrancy, Curves, and more with a single click. It also includes powerful Brushes for painting image adjustments onto parts of your photo, and dozens of ready-to-use professional photo Effects. You can share your photos directly to Facebook, Flickr and SmugMug and add them to shared photo streams using iCloud. You can also showcase your best work as an impressive coffee table-style photo book or as stunning slideshows that weave together photos, audio, text, and HD video.   Ã¢â‚¬Â¨Ã¢â‚¬Â¨

Fully optimized for Retina displayÃ¢â‚¬Â¨
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Optimized Viewer allows you to see more of your high-resolution images onscreen with pixel-for-pixel accuracyÃ¢â‚¬Â¨
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Displays razor-sharp thumbnails in Browser

Ã¢â‚¬Â¨Aperture and iPhoto Unified Library
Ã¢â‚¬Â¨Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Share one photo library across both applications
Ã¢â‚¬Â¨Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ No need to import, export, or reprocess photos from one app to the otherÃ¢â‚¬Â¨
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Faces, Places, albums, web sharing, and more work with both applicationsÃ¢â‚¬Â¨
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Adjustments done in either app are non-destructive and visible in the otherÃ¢â‚¬Â¨

Organize photos using Faces and Places Ã¢â‚¬Â¨
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Use face detection and recognition to organize your photos by the people in them Ã¢â‚¬Â¨
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Explore photos based on where you took them, using robust GPS support Ã¢â‚¬Â¨
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Drag photos to an interactive map to add location data easily 

Perfect images with Brushes and Effects
Ã¢â‚¬Â¨Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Retouch photos nondestructively using edge-aware brushes Ã¢â‚¬Â¨
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Handle the most common touch-up tasks with a set of 10 Quick Brushes 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¨Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Choose from dozens of ready-to-use effects or create and share your own effects Ã¢â‚¬Â¨
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ See results of any effect in a live preview window before applying it to an image

Ã¢â‚¬Â¨Create stunning multimedia slideshows 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¨Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Use professionally designed themes to weave together photos and HD video clips Ã¢â‚¬Â¨
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Add text to slides using your choice of fonts, styles, and colors Ã¢â‚¬Â¨
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Build a layered soundtrack with location audio clips and music tracks 

Share photos with built-in iCloud supportÃ¢â‚¬Â¨
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ View and automatically import recent photos taken on your iOS devices
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Automatically send newly-imported photos to all your iOS devices
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Post photos and videos to other peopleÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s shared photo streams, or create your own streams to share with friends and family
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ View and add comments and Ã¢â‚¬Å“likesÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ to photos and videos in any shared stream


Whats New in Version 3.5
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Adds support for iCloud Photo Sharing, including the ability to post videos to shared photo streams and to have multiple subscribers contribute to a shared stream
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ The Places feature now uses Apple maps to display photo locations
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ New integration with SmugMug, with support for publishing and syncing galleries directly to a SmugMug account
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Adds support for iOS 7 camera filters applied to photos imported from iOS devices
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Fixes an issue that sometimes resulted in Retouch adjustments not being applied to exported images
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Addresses an issue that could cause the black and white points in Curves to shift incorrectly when using the eyedropper tools
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Fixes a problem that prevented caption data from being embedded correctly when exporting versions of some RAW file types
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Improves reliability when adding names to Faces 
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Addresses an issue that could cause Aperture to hang after adjusting a very large panorama
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Fixes a problem that could prevent memory cards or hard disks from ejecting properly after import when clicking the Delete Items button
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Improves reliability of slideshows on a 15" Macbook Pro with Retina display
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Addresses an issue that could cause thumbnails to display incorrectly in the iLife Media Browser
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Videos up to three minutes long can now be shared to Flickr
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Captions instead of version names are now synced between Aperture and Facebook for newly-created albums
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Improves reliability when printing a light table
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Fixes an issue that could prevent adjusted images from being published to My Photo Stream
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Includes stability and performance improvements

What's New in Version 3.5.1
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Temperature & Tint White Balance now works correctly
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Fixes an issue related to face detection overlays
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Addresses an issue with metadata field entry when arrowing between photos
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Includes stability improvements
